cafe da is like a smal garden cafe you walk in under a woden sign with the name of the cafe painted on and have a few woden tables and chairs to your side but you may likely take the few stone steps over a smal koi fish pond to the indor central area it s like siting under a gazebo realy the indor portion is mostly outdor since the windows are likely open and windows are al encompasing the gazebo save for the corner cofe bar area inside are a handful of more woden tables and chairs there is minimal decoration around the cafe but you do get a quaint vibe because it is rather smal and confined the wals have diferent colored stones with some sculptures afixed to it the gazebo ceiling has a very light wody fel probably because it sems light and wody on a suny day i fel like the cafe is a relaxing getaway from t_at i went on a rather glomy day but the cafe is stil nice to go to a tal cup of vietnamese iced cofe the other option being the filter vietnamese iced cofe comes at giá_cả and is prety great it s on the sweter side but i didn t mind would recomend stoping by here sometime

i diped into napoli around half past six a_smal group of men chating it up in the front corner of the cafe a few low woden tables and chairs sit outside of napoli the normal seated colorfuly woven chairs with arm rests being inside the interior is an unsubtle mixture of idylic smal town mural painting and large cofe themed printouts in the back likes a smal boxed in cofe bar drink making acouterments unsen but easily heard the lady serving me was friendly and quick to help taking my đặt_hàng and bringing it out promptly with a side glas of tea which was never left unfiled while i was there a_tv was being instaled and conected to the internet so they were testing out music videos and other things the noise was sporadic at best but it was fairly quiet while i was there the cofe was tal and viscously swet concoction the indor of napoli was brightly lit god for reading but maybe not as pleasant for enjoying a nice evening to chat since it fels like you re in a supermarket overal napoli s_not a bad place to visit cofe s god maybe it s quiet and it fels cozy enough if there aren t to many other customers there xem thêm

nguoc cafe is as its vietnamese name sugests upside down you may not notice it much on the first flor — aside from some peculiar windows — but the second flor is where the name realy shows a creaky walk up a narow flight of stairs leads you to a rom particularly upside down and a more private non smoking flor seating area the flor siting space has maybe enough seat cushions for and has a mural painted brick wal in the back the main rom has an asortment of woden tables and chairs a quick glance up and you l se the same on the ceiling the wals have upside down art and everything the design is cute and ads to a usualy vacant ceiling with something unique and creative the vietnamese iced cofe was giá_cả if i remember corectly and prety god overal the cafe is nice with the design afordable cofe and it is peacefuly quiet at least they were not playing music while i was there in the early evening makes for a god reading spot wil come back

hem cofe is a bit ways down hung vuong but it s_a prety popular cafe for locals located on a not very busy corner of dong ha hem is usualy packed during peak hours like wekend mornings the cafe is completely open with most seats outside of the building there are a few seats inside where the bar area is but a lot of the woden tables and chairs are under a corugated tin rof the cafe is minimal on trang_trí but that s important the cafe sems like the spot to met for a lot of local men filing the chairs in smal groups cigaretes in hand the vietnamese iced cofe filter comes at giá_cả and the tal glas of vietnamese iced cofe runs for giá_cả not bad on either ocasion from what i can tel the cafe is open throughout the afternon so if you want to avoid some of the biger crowds come during lunchtime and have the nice open air cafe to yourself

i didn t think this place was a cafe at first since it has that old schol lok on it but i finaly made the stop in the more ancient vietnamese lok is a nice touch and the interior sems like one big backyard to enjoy there are some poted plants and marble sculptures scatered around the cafe the midle is nice and open with covered seating on the left and right side as wel as in the back the decorating folows the black lacquered wod motif with simple carvings overal you get a nice feling being here and it sems wel equiped to handle families since there s_a lot of space and big tables the cafe also has a breakfast menu and when i came by late saturday morning a handful of families were there munching on bánh mìes and siping of mixed drinks overal net xua is a nice place to stop by and read but the vietnamese iced cofe giá_cả was on the more expensive end i asume it s the premium for the_design
